data.title: Nominations/Predictions for David Garibaldi's Successor in Tower of Power
data.meta_description: There will never be another David Garibaldi. He was THE perfect drummer for Tower of Power and, in many ways, defined their sound. Others have done a good...
data.text:
There will never be another David Garibaldi. He was THE perfect drummer for Tower of Power and, in many ways, defined their sound. Others have done a good job in his absence, but DG personified the "East Bay" funk sound.

Weighing the music side of things and the business side, I'm guessing that many of the best candidates wouldn't be willing or able to make the commitment that TOP would require.

I nominate Larnell Lewis. He would slay that gig. Nate Smith is another one who would absolutely crush it (or just about anything, for that matter) and he definitely loves ToP, but I don't think he'd want to put his own band, Kinfolk, on the back burner to make it happen. Adam Deitch would slay it, as well, but I don't think he'd leave Lettuce to make it work. Similarly, Keith Carlock would be great in ToP, but I doubt he'd leave Steely Dan to make himself available.

Interested in hearing the forum's thoughts on this.

Interested in hearing the forum's thoughts on this.

Well you already named the 2 I as gonna pick: Nate Smith and Deitch.

Although both have a lot going on with their own projects.

Stanton could be a fun candidate for a stint as a sub, injecting a smidge of NoLa greasiness into TOP might be interesting.

Weighing the music side of things and the business side, I'm guessing that many of the best candidates wouldn't be willing or able to make the commitment that TOP would require.

Herman will be subbing for some gigs. I would look more for a Russ McKinnon as he was in the band, knows the music and is still friends with the guys. Those other drummers are all great but Tower will look for someone they can get along with the other 22 hours they are not on stage. Also, its a business. Tower i would imagine does not pay a whole lot.

Well Gents, as i mentioned previously, the next drummer for Tower would not be a big name for numerous reasons. While i would love to see anyone of your suggestions on big names come true, its just not going to happen. The first few dates were filled in by Herman Matthews. Recently a drummer named Peter Antunes has been on the kit. Maybe they bring back Russ McKinnon? Maybe Rocky Bryant wants the gig once The Average White Band retires this year? Not sure. But one things for sure....those big names are most likely not coming. Sorry guys.
